Type: Low-impact aerobic (over-ground or treadmill walking with rails, stationary or arm cycling, aquatic exercise)
HeartRateZone: 40-70% HRR or RPE 11-14—stop if symptoms last >60 min
RestPeriod: Brief 1–2-min pauses every 5–10 min; avoid >48 h between sessions
Progression: Add 5 min or slight speed/grade every 2 weeks when symptom-free
Supervision: Begin during ‘good’ cognitive periods with a neuro-PT; monitor HR, BP & symptom diary

Type: Progressive resistance training (8–10 major muscle groups, slow concentric tempo)
Progression: Increase load ≤10 % when 12 reps feel easy and no post-exercise fatigue
Supervision: Initial technique with PT/trainer; strap or support paretic limb if needed

Type: Balance & vestibular drills (tandem stance, gaze-stabilisation, obstacle steps)
Flexibility for neck, trunk & lower limbs
Progression: Reduce hand support or add dual-task/eyes-closed challenges once steady
Supervision: Train near a stable rail or partner; stop if dizziness or headache spikes
